title: Trump is risking his reelection with the trade war, says Strategas analyst Clifton
text: President Donald Trump's trade war risks damaging the economy, as well as his own re-election chances, according to Strategas.

title: Global Markets Mixed As China Works to Slow Yuan Slide
text: U.S. equity markets look set to rise after China's central bank made attempts to curb the depreciation of the yuan.

title: Huawei asked people if they thought it was linked to Chinese government     - CNET
text: The phonemaker polled its Twitter followers about #WhoRunsHuawei, and the vast majority think it's owned by the government.

title: Trade War May Not End Before Election
text: What if the trade war goes on past the election? Both the U.S. and Chinese economies could be deeply damaged.

title: It's Time for Some Perspective on Stock Market Corrections and "Plunges"
text: The stock market's worst trading day of 2019 isn't a reason to worry. Rather, it's an opportunity.

title: China's state council announces special tax policies in Shanghai Free Trade Zone
text: China said it will implement a special tax policy in the Shanghai Free Trade Zone, the country's State Council or cabinet said on Tuesday.

title: Former Fed chairs say the US central bank must be free of 'political pressures'
text: The four living former chairs of the Federal Reserve called for the U.S. central bank to remain free to work independently and without fear of political reprisals.

title: Oil hovers around $60 as U.S.-China trade tensions weigh
text: Oil prices rebounded slightly on Tuesday from big falls in recent sessions, but Brent crude remained near seven-month lows around $60 a barrel due to escalating trade tensions between China and the United States.

title: SF Fed's Daly says she's focused on trade tensions
text: San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly says she is focused on the impact of U.S.-China trade tensions as she weighs the central bank's next move on interest rates.

title: Oil Reverses Drop After China's Yuan Fix Soothes Investor Nerves
text:

The post Oil Reverses Drop After China's Yuan Fix Soothes Investor Nerves appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: China says U.S. currency manipulator labeling could cause chaos in financial markets
text: China's central bank said on Tuesday that Washington's decision to label Beijing as a currency manipulator would "severely damage international financial order and cause chaos in financial markets".

title: Rout relents as China keeps yuan on leash
text: A rout in global markets moderated on Tuesday as China kept the yuan on a tight leash after its landmark drop past 7-per-dollar led the United States to label Beijing a currency manipulator.

title: ‘Ready to Rumble’: U.S.-China Fight Puts World Economy on the Brink
text: A trade war spills into the realm of currency, with no end in sight.

title: Exclusive: India raises cost of refinery project with Aramco by 36% - sources
text: India has increased the cost estimate of a giant refinery and petrochemical project to be jointly built with Saudi Aramco and Abu Dhabi National Oil Co by more than 36%, after protests by farmers forced the relocation of the plant, four sources said.

title: Goldman Sachs sees no trade deal before 2020 U.S. election, now expects three rate cuts
text: Goldman Sachs said it no longer expects the United States and China to agree on a deal to end their prolonged trade dispute before the November 2020 presidential election as policymakers from the world's largest economies are "taking a harder line".

title: More flexible yuan could be positive for China's credit rating: Fitch
text: A freer-floating yuan could be a positive for China’s sovereign credit rating, agency Fitch said on Tuesday, by helping preserve its foreign exchange reserves and cushioning some of the negative effects of U.S. trade tariffs.

title: China firmly opposes currency manipulator label: PBOC
text: China firmly opposes a U.S. decision to label it a currency manipulator, its central bank said on Tuesday, adding that Beijing has not used and will not use the yuan to cope with trade frictions with the world's biggest economy.

title: Europe stocks open narrowly lower after China takes step to lower yuan concerns
text: European stocks opened with narrow losses after China's central bank set the yuan's reference point higher than expected early Tuesday.

title: Australian stock market down 2.4% as US-China trade war hits home
text: Economists say a reluctant Canberra may need to spend cash to get Australia moving as ASX200 index falls for fifth day in a row

title: Cathay Pacific reveals it's monitoring passengers with onboard cameras
text: Hong Kong airline Cathay Pacific has revealed it is monitoring passengers via onboard cameras.

title: America, Australia, And Japan Try To Limit China's Rare Earth Dominance -- It Won't Be Easy
text: Teaming up with the right partners may help America discover and mine rare earths, but it won't limit China’s dominance in the market for these important materials.

title: What Chinese state media are saying about the falling yuan and escalating trade war
text: China's state newspaper on Tuesday slams the U.S. for "deliberately destroying international order," one day after Washington branded Beijing a currency manipulator.

title: Stocks rout deepens as U.S. sets crosshairs on yuan
text: Global stocks extended already substantial losses on Tuesday, after Washington tagged China a currency manipulator, shaking fragile investor sentiment in a rapid escalation of the U.S.-China trade war.

title: The Federal Reserve announces plans for a real-time payments system that will be available to all banks
text: The Federal Reserve Bank announced today that it is developing a new service called FedNow that will allow all banks in the United States to offer 24/7 real-time payment services every day of the week. FedNow is expected to be available by 2023 or 2024 and will initially support transfers of up to $25,000.

title: 'Speculative Trading' At China's New Tech Exchange Threatens To Derail Its Nasdaq Ambitions
text: China’s new tech board in Shanghai was modeled after the Nasdaq Stock Market with the aim of attracting more tech listings at home, but high volatility driven in large part by speculative trading is already casting doubts on that vision.

title: Stock losses deepen as U.S. puts yuan in crosshairs
text: Global stocks extended already substantial losses on Tuesday, after Washington designated Beijing a currency manipulator and further rattled fragile investor sentiment in a rapid escalation of the U.S.-China trade war.

title: Some Wall Street workers face pay slump in 2019: report
text: Many Wall Street workers will see their pay stay flat or decline this year, as big banks and money managers continue to cut costs, according to a report on Tuesday by compensation consultancy Johnson Associates.

title: Yale economist Stephen Roach: US declaring China a currency manipulator is an 'empty threat'
text: China will not respond to the Trump administration's name-and-shame approach and will hit back if the U.S. imposes more tariffs, says said Stephen Roach.
